metadata.name: Is this role being posted for the immigration team?

title: Lead Pharmacy Technician
content:
The Pharmacy Technician Lead will be responsible for leading a team hands-on in the pharmacy operation and will build and maintain relationships with hourly team members. Under the direction of management, the Lead will train Team Members through the assignment of work-flow and effectively reports information to management to provide outstanding service to the customers. The incumbent is expected to set an example for other employees through professional conduct and by safely performing all assigned tasks to predetermined standards. In this flexible position, the tasks may include sorting, loading, palatalizing, scanning and quality assurance. The incumbent is expected to report any violations of company policy and procedures to management. This person will be someone enjoys change and getting into the details to drive improvements every single day.
 What You'll do:

Lead a team of up to 35 hourly team members
Train Team Members to safely and accurately perform tasks to predetermined standards.
Based on operational plans and company standards, assign Team Members to work areas to customer service & reach operational goals.
Provide management feedback of Team Members and then provide on-the-job training to meet training needs.
Notify management of equipment malfunctions and other potential safety issues.
Send out quarterly progress reports and deep dive successes and missed opportunities.  
Ability to troubleshoot equipment and basic software issues
Understand basic Outbound Flow and strategically place team members to enable best throughout practices. 
Maintain a clean and safe work area. Promote safety programs and recommend corrective actions. 
Ability to lead a team by leading stand up and stand downs.  Speaking to large groups
Provide constructive feedback to team members as well as recognizing a job well done
Educate team members on the “Whys and How’s” of a process
Support continuous improvement efforts through waste elimination.
Capable of covering a shift if supervisor is absent.  
Create a positive team dynamic that encourages all employees in the FC to provide feedback and drive change within the facility, adapt to the ever-changing business, and stay focused on the customer experience Unload, load, lift, push, and stack packages.
Utilize the site Warehouse Management System (WMS) to optimize perfect order fulfillment and provide operational insights to improve WMS effectiveness

What You'll Need:

Must be able to stand for long periods of time, lift up to 25 lbs. and bend, lift safely and repetitively
Must be a CPhT (certified pharamcy technician) in the state of Texas.
Ability to read, comprehend and carry out simple instructions from oral instructions or written correspondence
Good communicator and active listener
Comply with all company policies, procedures and safety guidelines
High level of professionalism and strong work ethic
The ability to adjust to sudden changes in customer demands or operational goals
Ability to plan and schedule tasks and handle multiple tasks at once
Adhere to quality and performance standards
Carry out responsibilities in accordance with the organization’s policies and procedures
Ability to work in a fast paced distribution environment
Must be self-motivated and able to work in a team-oriented environment with an emphasis on total customer satisfaction
Detail oriented and accurate
Ability to focus attention on details
Ability to prioritize, manage and complete projects with tight deadlines

Chewy is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity and inclusion of all Team Members. If you have a disability under the Americans with Disabilities Act or similar law, and you need an accommodation during the application process or to perform these job requirements, or if you need a religious accommodation, please contact CAAR@chewy.com.
 
If you have a question regarding your application, please contact HR@chewy.com.
 
To access Chewy's Customer Privacy Policy, please click here. To access Chewy's California CPRA Job Applicant Privacy Policy, please click here.

questions.label: Are you 18 years of age or older?
Have you been employed by Chewy in the past?
Are you legally authorized to work in the United States without employer support or sponsorship?
Are you willing to submit to a post-offer, pre-employment background check and drug test?
How did you hear about Chewy?
Will you require sponsorship to work in the United States at any time in the future?

SMS Consent: By providing my telephone number on this employment application form, I consent to receive automated text messages and pre-recorded voice messages from Chewy at that telephone number regarding any matter related to my job application to Chewy. Chewy will not use this telephone number for marketing or advertising solicitation purposes. Message and data rates may apply. You may opt out of these messages at any time by replying 'STOP' to any text messages you receive.
